website_summaries.verdict: Nylabone’s best offering for large breeds is this sturdy and bulky nylon barbell, and its longevity is well worth the price.
pros: Extra thick and sturdy nylon barbell shape
Available in large and giant sizes, this toy is for tough chewers
cons: It’ll hurt if you step on it by accident

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product so she wouldn’t be able to destroy it and make a mess like stuffed toys that claim to be indestructible, while giving her something to chew on. Gave my dog this toy and within 20 minutes this happened. The part she chewed created sharp bits of plastic that cut her gums. Not safe and DO NOT purchase for actual power chewers! She has also injested small parts of plastic that she was able to chew off. Please do not buy this product for your own fur baby’s safety.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These bones are huge! I have paid 2x as much at pet stores for half the size! My pits love Nylabones. These should last a while! Please note: these bones do wear down over time until they are too small to allow your dog to chew. After they become a choking hazard please discard. Chewing can cause your dogs gums to bleed. That is the PURPOSE. Your dog develops tartar/plaque just like we do and as they chew it wears away the build-up on the teeth. Just like ours may bleed during a dental cleaning. Dogs need bones and rope to promote healthy teeth and gums or they will rot and cause extreme pain. This is not a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: My German shepherd destroyed this
customer_reviews.text: This is made out of some kind of hard plastic that gets sharp when chewed on. It will draw blood when chewed on enough, this is not something I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TZE-LE

customer_reviews.title: I did not give this to my dog because there ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not give this to my dog because there were no ingredients listed. My concern was if the peanut butter flavor contained xylitol which is very dangerous for dogs. I think it would be wise to have ingredients listed.
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Dog favorite
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month golden retriever loves it! She is a strong chewer and eventually chewed through the smaller end. We will definitely purchase again. The bone lasted her over 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: lucido09

customer_reviews.title: Peanut butter is always a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never met a dog that didn’t like the peanut butter flavor nylabones. They’re always the favorite in our 2 dog household (55 pounds and 90 pounds). This shape in the 50+ pound size was larger than expected, which is fine. The shape is novel and it’s a nice change for them. The two bulbous ends give them good grip opportunities and it’s easy to carry around holding the middle. I’d buy it again. You could probably size down with this style if your dog isn’t an aggressive chewer. Even we could probably get away with the next smaller size if we had too.
customer_reviews.author: Dimples

customer_reviews.title: Beware though it is thick as a brick and sounds like one when dropped on a hard surface
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bone for months, by dog is a major chewer and destroys all toys he gets immediately. But not this one. He's barely made a dent in it. Beware though it is thick as a brick and sounds like one when dropped on a hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Long Chew and Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit bull mix that can destroy every bone and toy within minutes, but she seems to have a tough time with this one. She would run to it every morning and work at it. It's even flavored with peanut butter! My dog loves it! Definitely worth the investment and great way to make my furry friend happy!
customer_reviews.author: Infamous K

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Cut dogs gums
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This isn't first Nylabone Dura Chew we have used. The others lasted at least 2 months. We are throwing this one out after only 2 weeks of use. It has sliced up dogs gums and there is blood on bone. Not sure what is different that is causing this, the other bones were the same material.
customer_reviews.author: Tristin

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Sturdy, Replace after nylon starts shredding
customer_reviews.text: Great chew toy for our 1 year old Black Lab. As with all Dog chews, do not leave your Pet unattended. Follow manufacturers directions. Chew toy should be washed and rinsed. When the nylon threads start to break off, plan to throw it away so your FurBaby doesn’t get a tooth or gum injury. Our FurBaby weighs 44 pounds and I let her chew on her toy 4-5 times a day for about 20 minutes. Photograph shows how bone looks after a few weeks of chewing. Recommend and will order again. Make sure you order the proper size for your Pet to avoid any injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. K

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: High quality dog chew toy for my power chewer! I have a 100lb American Bully who can chew threw most toys in minutes. He absolutely loves this peanut butter flavored bone & has been chewing on it daily for about a week. Based on past experience this will last months before it looks yucky & that’s the only reason why I finally got him a fresh new one. Definitely 5 stars because it’s hard to find indestructible dog toys but this one is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Tristen Dague

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase I shouldn't have made. Two minutes and a sharp piece of plastic comes off and my dog's lip is bleeding. Two minutes. I'll stick to antlers and dog cookies. Never will I buy another nylabone product again.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Know what you’re buying
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviewers do not know what a nylabone is. If you have a teething dog, or you don’t brush your dog’s teeth, nylabones are exactly what they need. The hard material scrapes at plaque and the chewing strengthens their jaw. My dog loved this thing for at least two months, until it was so chewed up I thought he’d eat it. Not bad for a dog who destroys everything on sight.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: My heeler loves chewing and can rip apart and shred a tennis ball in under 10 minutes so she needs good chew toys to prevent her from being destructive in ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so necessary if you have a dog that likes to chew. My heeler loves chewing and can rip apart and shred a tennis ball in under 10 minutes so she needs good chew toys to prevent her from being destructive in the house. I have several nylabones for her but this is one of her favorites. I think she likes trying to chew off the little bumps on it. Would definitely recommend to anyone who has a dog that loves to chew!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Definitely durable.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with the quality of this DuraChew. My 100lb lab goes nuts over anything peanut butter and did go to town on this when he first got it. I think maybe because he was not able to destroy it in a few days, he lost interest. I don't know if the flavor dissipates with time, but my dog does not really give it much attention anymore. Maybe the indentation from his teeth has caused the surface to become scratchy and somewhat dangerous. In any case, it is the first toy that has outlasted my dog's interest and that is an accomplishment. Good job, Nylabone!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for Weimeraner and Big enough for Great Dane!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Nylabone Barbell for my two dogs. I recently purchased another monster size Nylabone and was so pleased with it that I wanted to get this one too. It is strong enough for my 70 pound weimeraner and big enough for my 145 pound great dane. They absolutely love this bone. There are nubs all over the chew which help to scrape tartar off the teeth. The dogs seem to enjoy the different sized and shaped ends of the chew. They like to take turns chewing. This is a GREAT choice for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.author: MicP

customer_reviews.title: Great for hardcore destructive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! Our Pups are chewers. Our new girl is like a dang alligator lol! Nothing has held up to her destructive chewing power until we found and tried these bones! They keep her occupied and content. They last the longest out of anything else we found in this type of bone. Even once she gets them to where they're technically ruined they're still safe as any pieces that do break off are very tiny and pass easily through the digestive tract and don't cause any issues or harm, the biggest reason we really love these bones!
customer_reviews.author: WhiskerTamer

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE! Chewing causes sharp edges and cuts mouth!
customer_reviews.text: My dog had this less than a day and chewed on it twice. The little bit of chewing she did do so far created little indents on the bone leaving sharp edges and now her mouth is bleeding. Definitely NOT for power chewers like it claims. I will never give my dog a nylabone again.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerA

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: My monster chewers love these things. The bone is huge.... foot bruising heavy, 10" long, 1.5" round. Looks more like something adults would play with instead of dogs, and other than maybe a few curious looks when people see them laying on the floor, they hold up to heavy chewing very well. Only deducted a star for quality control. Had to shave some of the plastic from the side before they could be chewed on.
customer_reviews.author: uɐʎɹ

customer_reviews.title: Great durability
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the advid chewer. The only downside is if your dog is like mine and likes to bring you their toys. This toy hurts when my my dog comes running to me with it. It has bumps all over and when your dog chews it the bumps turn into little hurtful spikes. Everyone in my house has been on the receiving end of these spikes including my 4 year old nephew. Great durability for an advid chewer but stay clear when your dog trys to bring it to you.
customer_reviews.author: duane

customer_reviews.title: My boxer loves this
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few types of toys recently including two varieties of Nylabone. This ended up being my boxer's favorite toy. He plays with it, chews it and right down to takes it to bed with him. So far, it is not showing any wear. My previous nylabone toy was also a hit with him, and he still has that 4 years after that purchase. He is not an aggressive chewer obviously, but he does have an urge to chew.
customer_reviews.author: Ozarkrider

customer_reviews.title: My Floofs LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: We are a repeat buyer of these specific nylabone barbell chew toys. Our dogs (a golden retriever and lab/Rhodesian mix) will spend all day chewing away on these guys and it will take them months to get through it. They usually end up favoring one side and then lose interest in it... but It is worth the investment considering how long it takes for them to get to that point! Just a point of warning... these things are HEAVY and HARD so watch your toes if your pooch is anything like mine and just drops it on the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Tiny pieces easily chewed off and ingested
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and hard but my 20 lb 9 month old puppy managed to chew off and ingest tiny, sharp, hard bits. These bits cause him to gag up phlegm to dislodge bits from his throat. The product is extremely hard and I’m certain it could last a very long time but it only took two chewing sessions before I discarded into the trash because I’m certain I don’t want a barfing dog.
customer_reviews.author: dMarie

customer_reviews.title: My 8 week GSD pup did not even touch it
customer_reviews.text: I had great expectations after reading the reviews, but my 8 week GSD pup did not even play with it for 5 seconds. It is hard and heavy and nothing like a nylabone which is a still soft. This is hard plastic. I dont know about other dogs but did not work for me. I would have returned it. But the pup made some scratches in the 5 seconds it played.
customer_reviews.author: 4SLG744

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for agressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been through so many chew toys with my now 10 month old shih tzu pomeranian mix pup. He destroys them all within minutes. Yet, this toy is still going! He has considerably worn down the ends within a month but I'm still amazed that any toy would last this long. This buy was definitely worth it. It's harder than other chew toys but I've had no problems with bleeding gums like others have mentioned. I'll definitely be looking out for similar toys in this line.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee D

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: Nylabones are the ONLY thing that my crazy chewer dog can’t get through, and this shape seems particularly suited for her. These last about a year in my house, as opposed to (no exaggeration) the ten minutes that most “heavy duty” chewing toys offer. And my dogs LOVE them - I buy them in pairs because they’re so cheap, and they still fight over them! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Wnabtokio

customer_reviews.title: Not Loving It
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had a bunch of Nylabones for our French Bulldog, but this is the first one that she hasn’t been into... ever. We’ve now had it for several months, and she has hardly bothered to look at it, let alone chew it. I’m still giving it 3 stars, because it might be that my dog just isn’t into the scent, shape or texture; I’m not sure, and the dog won’t tell me. Use your words, dog!
customer_reviews.author: JC Lach

customer_reviews.title: Santa in January for these lucky furkids!
customer_reviews.text: My furbabies give these Nylabone Barbells a two paws up! They might be wondering if Santa has visited in January:) Our furkids love to play with their Nylabone Chew Toys. Between the Nylabone and Kong Toys, they never run out of something to play with. We keep a big toy basket with various toys for the furkids but our Jack Russell is always just dumping them out all over everywhere-but since the Nylabone & KONG Toys are virtually indestructible, we just scoop everything all up and put them back into the basket then she dumps them out all over again (AND AGAIN!). Sometimes we wonder 'who is training who'??
customer_reviews.author: cyn

customer_reviews.title: 6 month old labradoodle loves, but it is heavy as a brick
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. She is an aggressive chewer and loves to go to town on this toy. The only thing that I do not like about it is that it is so heavy that I am scared to toss it anywhere in my house because it is heavy enough to leave marks or dents on the baseboards. Also, multiple times my dog has walked up with it, trying to get me to play with her while I was cooking or preoccupied, and dropped it on my toe. Not a good feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: My dog does love this toy. There was a fake bone he seemed to like a little bit more than this one, so it might not have been his favorite- but the other one was much more expensive and much less durable. it was twice the size as this one and he actually ground it down more than 70%. this bone is almost perfect condition still. He forgets about it for a week then goes crazy for it for days lol. Nylabone makes great products.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Barber

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously sharp when chewed. Bad purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this item since it had good reviews. We bought this for our rescue lab mix & within an hour, she had chewed a side down so much that the plastic was sharpened to several points. My 3 year old came running to the kitchen as I was cooking dinner to tell me our dog Sadie was bleeding from her mouth. The toy had cut her fairly deep & when I grabbed the toy to toss it, I actually cut my finger as well. Will NOT be purchasing or recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for agressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50 lb lab and she loves to chew on hard toys. She has gone through some of the other, smaller Nylabones in a couple of weeks. She has had this for a couple of months now and has hardly done any damage to it! It is big and heavy so watch your toes if you don't have shoes on, but I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Anthonyi

customer_reviews.title: True advertising
customer_reviews.text: This so called hunk of plastic is horrid. I have a Great Dane and it’s too bulky for her. It sounds terrible around the house. It’s too hard. Junk!!!!! My dog just stares at it!! False advertising
customer_reviews.author: linda clark

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable for a Brittany!
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as: "Long-lasting chew toy in delicious peanut butter flavor challenges even the most aggressive chewers and discourages destructive chewing. Tough, durable nylon bone keeps powerful chewers busy." Our Brittany Spaniel had this for less than 2 hours and was able to chew the little "nubs" off the ends and eat them. I guess it's not harmful, but I don't like the idea of her ingesting any part of this bone. If your dog is a heavy chewer, I would possibly recommend a smooth toy or bone. That's what i'm planning on switching our puppy over to.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 month old golden. She chewed on one side for about 5 minutes when I first gave it to her and has been completely uninterested in it ever since. She chewed off a piece of it and it got into my carpet. Also, the other end she didn’t even touch is covered in dog hair frequently, even if I rinse it off. It just catches in the knobs before it’s even used. Don’t recommend for long hair, homes with carpet, or dogs over 50 lbs due to size of the bone.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Toughest toy we bought
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item, I didn't expect to get this huge bone. My pup, who usually destroys everything we give to her, is still trying to make a dent in this one. It's not for a small to medium size dog, as it's fairly heavy and large around. For a larger dog, it's a great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: La Mar R. Binder

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My dog had no interest in chewing on this. I'm not sure if it was lack of flavor or what, but he sniffed it, picked it up for a few seconds, and then never looked back. It doesn't even feel like a chew toy, it just feels like hard, glass like plastic. I tried to return it but amazon said it wasn't a returnable item. So after a couple weeks of it just sitting, I took some actual peanut butter and rubbed it all around the top half of it... he licked it off and then walked away.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyaa C.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and delicious chew bone, dangerous when run over with lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: Good strong chewing bone. Delicious ( I assume) Lasts a long time, even with 2 large dogs that will obsessively chew any other chew toy to bits the first day. Only problem is they are not allowed outside. When run over with a lawn mower, they can cause sever damage to surrounding structures with shrapnel like pieces launched in all directions. Will continue to buy about 2 per year.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: If your dog has destroyed everything get one of these
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab mix who is a very aggressive chewer and this is her favorite toy. All other squeaky/rubbery chew toys labeled as for aggressive chewers she has managed to destroy in minutes but this one stands the test of time. I've had two of these and one lasted for at least 2 years with near daily chewing. The only reason I got rid of it was because she had focused all her time on one end and slowly made it into what looked like a prison shank.
customer_reviews.author: Bgdhick Tony

customer_reviews.title: Time to get these baby teeth out!
customer_reviews.text: @Finley_theaus approves! Finley is 6 months old and a teething Australian shepherd. He loves the different textures in this nylabone and has chomped, dropped, thrown and chomped some more and it has held up great. This is our first Nylabone and we really like it during this teething stage.
customer_reviews.author: @Finley_theaus

customer_reviews.title: Really... indestructible
customer_reviews.text: My dog chews EVERYTHING. He is a miniature australian shepherd and he gets bored easily. I purchased two of these and he has barely made a dent. He will hoard them both and chew away until content. This keeps him from chewing my walls and baseboards so I am a happy camper.... Yes, he gets plenty of exercise but he still wants to chew chew chew.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Y

customer_reviews.title: Not for smart dogs
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old puppy tore this up in less than 3 weeks. The bone itself would have been fine but all the tiny bumps are easy for a dog to tear it up and swallow. My puppy is extremely smart, she is not a strong chewer but will find any week spots to any toy and tear it up, if this sounds like your dog I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Keller

customer_reviews.title: Destructo-dog approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have a year old Lab/Shepard mix and he is definitely a destructive chewer . He will sit for hours and chew something for the purpose of demolishing it . As you can guess we go through an insane amount of toys (and money) and we’ve tried so many brands but in our experience Nylabone has been the best. We got this and he is absolutely loving it. It goes everywhere with him so that he can lay down and chew when he wants, it has held up wonderfully and it will definitely be a repeat purchase for us!
customer_reviews.author: katrinalynn

customer_reviews.title: Super Hard/Heavy
customer_reviews.text: My shorty Jack Russell is an expert chewer. Wood, sheetrock, furniture, cabinets. She will not play with this toy. I thing it is because it is too heavy. I was hoping it would be a distraction for her from the "good stuff".
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Still kickin!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Oct 2018 and it's still alive. It's obviously chewed on but I've not seen any little pieces coming off and the dogs still love it. We have a small husky and lab/pit, and a little pom (not much of a chewer). My husky loves it the most and it keeps him busy so I can also live my life. (He's very needy) Worst part about these chew toys is they're super painful when stepped on/kicked. Worse than legos some times.
customer_reviews.author: Alex House

customer_reviews.title: My Shepsky’s aren’t fans of this one
customer_reviews.text: Being Nylabone I expect this toy is just as durable as others, but I bought 2 of these for my Shepskys, and neither one will touch them!!!! It is the first toy I have bought for my 7 month old that she literally will not lick, chew, bite or even touch!!! They are laying at the bottom of the dog toy box!!! Not sure why they don’t like this one! Oh, and just FYI- my young one adores peanut butter!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Can't get enough peanut butter!!!
customer_reviews.text: My yellow Lab has always loved these bones, and this was her first peanut butter flavored one. Though it didn't seem to have a smell, she spends as much time sniffing and licking as she does chewing. However, the tiny scraps that often come off hurt when you step on them with a bare foot, so beware.
customer_reviews.author: Peggie Bell

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR SHELTER DOGS!!
customer_reviews.text: I work at a no-kill animal shelter and Nyla bones are the only things we can keep in their kennels when unsupervised. I try to collect them all a couple times a week, wash them and redistribute them so the dogs don’t get bored. Plus- they take them out in the yard with them and get them all dirty. They LOVE these and they are super durable. Thanks Nyla Bones!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Emery

customer_reviews.title: Truly durable and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: We used to buy bones that said they were durable from our local pet store; however, they would only last a couple of days. So far this one shows no signs of chewing or falling apart. If these end up being chewed up I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa 1966

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: OUR GSP IS QUITE A CHEWER AND I AM FREQUENTLY DISAPPOINTED WITH ITEMS MARKED TOUGH CHEWER AND THEY ARE DESTROYED IN MOMENTS-- NYLABONE HAS NOT EVER LET ME DOWN-- I HAD A PIT/BOXER MIX BEFORE AND THEIR PRODUCTS WORKED GREAT FOR HIM AS WELL (RIP) I AM A FAN---WELL, THE DOGS ARE, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is great item. My pibble (48 pounds of pure muscle) is a chewer/destroyer and likes it just fine. She likes others Nylabones better...thinking it's the shape she doesn't care for on this one as it is kind of a strange shape. Hurts like hell when you step on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, this is bigger than I thought it would be, but it is my fault for not paying attention to the product details. I am giving this 3 stars only b/c my dog doesn't care for it. To each their own; all dogs are different so I don't think it means the product isn't good. It may work for your dog (as per reviews, it clearly does for many).
customer_reviews.author: iamshopping

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Nylabone yet! Good for strong chewers
customer_reviews.text: I can't stress how much my dogs and I love this one. I love it because it's the biggest Nylabone I've seen and they dogs love it because of the textures. I wish I would have found this one sooner. I have a pitbull and cane corso. Big chewers. I will buy this one again and again. It's barley got a scratch on it and it's been a week.
customer_reviews.author: chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Death Balls
customer_reviews.text: My destructo dog has turned this into a weapon. Allow me to explain. While he can destroy it and rip it apart like most toys, which is good, he can however tear it up. So the balls on either end now are like balls of a mace. Sharp tiny plastic spikes pulled up by my dog who is a Sweety, but a 100 lb dufus. So he walks around slamming these plastic spike death balls into you trying to get you to play. Not cool bro. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Olson

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love 'em. Last all year.
customer_reviews.text: We buy two of these every year for our two large dogs. They actually carry them to bed, and one of our pups won't go out in the yard until he grabs his and takes it with him. Seems like they always know where the bones were left when they need to find one. Best dog chew we've found and we've tried many.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, solid, durable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid. I have some powerful chewers, But it’s a 17-pound chihuahua mix that likes to carry this thing around. They have all been chewing on it for weeks and it looks brand new. This thing should last forever!
customer_reviews.author: M. Auchter

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for an aggressive chewer- we have a Cur/ Boxer mix and not many toys make it past day one. This toy has been great and highly recommend! - note: its heavier than most toys so watch your toes
customer_reviews.author: Iversonsk

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Interest from Bella
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I don't feel I can write a fair review on this product as our Blue Heeler puppy has shown zero interest and this particular item. She loves lots of toys but doesn't seem to know this one actually exists!
customer_reviews.author: LaDonia Franke

customer_reviews.title: Dog's best friend
customer_reviews.text: These things last FOREVER. The first Nylabone we purchased for our Newfy mix lasted him a solid year. We'd have been able to make it last longer, but it had seen better days given the frequency of it ending up in mud/covered in hair. These things are susceptible to leaving shrapnel on the floor, so don't be surprised if you find yourself spot vacuuming just a little more. This is the only bone we will ever purchase for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Ben McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable!
customer_reviews.text: My power chewer has had this bone for over 6 months now and it has lasted! He can usually destroy a toy labeled as durable in a matter of days, but not this one! There are only some teeth marks in it after multiple months and I am definitely impressed with it!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Hays

customer_reviews.title: Not durable whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality if you have a German Shepherd or a power chewer. Mine is 7 months and he chewed this up in a few weeks (not continuously used throughout that time, maybe 5-7 times for around 10 mins). Take that with a grain of salt. Sticking to bully sticks because I haven’t really came across a durable product. I watch him chew on this because the plastic flakes off.
customer_reviews.author: Komal

customer_reviews.title: Great questionable looking chewy toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves nylabone toys. He is a coonhound mix and a heavy chewer and nibbler. This toy does have a questionable look to it. He definitely gets weird looks when he carries it around. Sorry to say it looks like a bumpy male part. But he loves it and it is good for a laugh.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Johns

customer_reviews.title: Dogs will be dogs
customer_reviews.text: The right individual to write this review would be Monty the Dog, but "bark bark bark" wouldn't explain much. Okay, the Dura Chew is VERY durable, and after months of Monty chewing and gnawing at this thing, it looks more or less like how it arrived. It's fun to throw around the house, easy to clean and doesn't smell like anything. Unfortunately, and through no fault of Nylabone, Monty uses dog logic and usually prefers to chew an old mangled tennis ball he found at the park, but outside of that, the Nylabone Dura Chew keeps his gnawing activities to it and not the expensive carpets he used to target.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Love Nylabone!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Nylabone bones for my dogs. We always have several lying around (take note: accidentally stepping on one is possibly worse than stepping on a lego...you’ve been warned) This bone (and the rest of our collection) keep our 65 lb dog busy!
customer_reviews.author: H. N.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe its too big? Dog doesn't like it. :(
customer_reviews.text: My labrador retriever LOVES Nylabone products. Just not this one. I don't know if its just too big, but I was very sad to see he didn't go crazy over the peanut butter flavor. He sometimes picks this up to show us when he gets excited, but then it just gets dropped (watch your toes!) and becomes a tripping hazard. He never takes it for a good chew sesh like he does his other Nylabones. This particular shape and size is very heavy and could probably crack ceramic tile if dropped (luckily he only drops it on our already dented and scratched hardwood).
customer_reviews.author: Powered by Coffee & Wine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog destroys every toy and devours every bone in minutes. We have had this for almost TWO years and it's still intact and has a lot more life to it. I imagine it'll last at least another 2 years but we will for sure buy more. I have also recommended it to people who have dogs like ours.
customer_reviews.author: K Launder

customer_reviews.title: Our dog didn't like it!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first bone we bought for our Vizsla, he chewed on it at first until I bought him one of the ones that look like a sling shot. He will only chew on these now and won't even lick on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Steve

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is trash. Hard plastic that seems like it will splinter and hurt my dog if I let them chew it. If I had seen this item in stores I would never have purchased. Protect your dog and don’t waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sharrow

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have an English Bulldog and these toys hold up extremely well. He loves this one since it’s peanut butter flavored. The price of this was so much cheaper than at the store if you can even find it at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Josef McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Love Nylabone line for aggressive chewers! Always a win and thanks Amazon for the great price! Small pieces eventually do come off and the bone will wear down... This is normal!!! Products always last a super long time!
customer_reviews.author: TLove

customer_reviews.title: Good for chewers, but gets too chewed within a few months
customer_reviews.text: My boxer mix loves these things, but she has had her latest one for about 3 months and is already starting to smack her lips when a piece of plastic breaks off and gets stuck in her jowls. Keep an eye on your pup, toss and repurchase when this happens, and they should be safe.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: My girl loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My collie mix loves to chew these. She likes to sit on the rug everyday and chew into one of her nylobones. As soon as I took this out of the box she ran up to it and sat as patiently as she could. She gives it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: GBS

customer_reviews.title: My Great Dane Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on the earlier review about the Great Dane enjoying his Monster bone. Our Great Dane is 7 months old & already 130+ lbs. It can be challenging to find a chew toy he can't consume. He really loves this bone to the point of chewing on it until he fell asleep, and even then kept his paw on it. The bone seems to be Great Dane proof! So far, so good. I'm always glad to find a toy he loves and I can feel safe in giving to him.
customer_reviews.author: Tina W

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love Nylabones for my dogs; it keeps them busy and if they are chewing on them then they are not eating my blankets or furniture. My dogs are power chewers so they love these. There are little burrs that come off of them and unfortunately those tend to get all over the floor or where the dogs are chewing. And they can swallow these pieces - our dogs haven't had any issues with these - we even check their teeth occasionally to ensure no damage is being done. I would definitely recommend this if you have power chewers- and be sure to get the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wolter

customer_reviews.title: Dobe loves these
customer_reviews.text: These products are always amazing! My doberman loves chewing and these always hit the spot for her. Anytime she gets a new one she gets super excited. Just be sure to throw them out once they start shredding them, the little tiny pieces are not good for them to swallow. But a good alternative to rawhide bones that are not good for dogs to digest.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Durable and the dogs love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: If your dogs leave their bones on the floor scattered, this product is a painful trip hazard for humans. If stepped on, it will hurt you- the little "projections" that help to clean dogs' teeth act like spikes when stepped on.. The smooth bone from Nylabone I usually get isn't nearly as bad as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Keethe Needles

customer_reviews.title: This one is the least favorite for all three dogs
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a third dog, and so I'm beefing up my toy and chew supplies. I purchased several Nylabones- this one in Medium, a synthetic cow hoof, a synthetic antler, a chicken flavored dental bone and on a whim, a Philly Cheesesteak flavored bone. This one is the least favorite for all three dogs, including the 'original' flavored souper bone that's really too big for all three dogs. The shape is awkward for them. The two round ends don't fit comfortably in their mouths to chew, and the center bar is not really accessible. I suspect they'd like it more in a more traditional shape.
customer_reviews.author: Khamsin

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my puppy who is a pretty good chewer. She had a regular nylabone before and tore through it in a few days. This one has lasted for four weeks now and is still going strong. Great price for something that keeps her well occupied. Will buy again when this one finally dies.
customer_reviews.author: MB121

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes it if I put peanut butter on it
customer_reviews.text: I've never had much success with dogs liking a hard nylon fake bone. I thought I'd give this a try because it's "flavored". My dog played with it for a few minutes because it was new, but doesn't go back to it. She prefers real knuckle bones.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Oddly this is a favorite
customer_reviews.text: I never in a million years would have thought that my fluffy dog toy loving pup would love a hard and rather boring rattle shaped chewy. Imagine my surprise when I have found by pup carrying this thing with him everywhere he goes. It has has held up and has kept his interest for over 2 months now. I am now a believer in these chews.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter's BandB

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These last so long for my aggressive chewer. I just wish everything wouldn’t get caught in the chewed up parts. I’m constantly cleaning off the fuzz from her other chewed up toys.
customer_reviews.author: Cillamac

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Great price on Amazon. Bought this because bulldog is a chow-hound intent on destroying anything she can. This Nylabone however holds up to her constant gnawing. It's heavy though. And sometimes doesn't satisfy her "search and destroy" mode. Overall decent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MeowsersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Have had a few of this material before and my pit bull loves it. It lasts forever. I feel like the complainers dogs have just never had their dog chew on anything this hard before so ya their gums may bleed at first. Kinda like humans flossing for the first time in a year...
customer_reviews.author: bennylog

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money and holds up great..
customer_reviews.text: My pitt can't chew through this,and loves this chew toy,But please be warned,the nubs on it become very sharp after they have chewed on them.I have noticed little sores(like little bite marks) under her lower mouth after the nubs have became sharp from chewing on it..They scab over and then she chews on it more and then you end up with little blood drops,from the sores...well worth the money and holds up great...Not sure i would buy again,due to the sore spots it causes
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Super toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this bone. She's so proud carrying it around. She is a very powerful chewer and this holds up well to her constant chewing. So glad I purchased it for her. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The Dogs Love It
customer_reviews.text: I don't get these Nylabone things. They don't smell good. (I haven't tasted them.) But I'm not a dog, so all I can say is that my dogs love whatever magic ingredient is in them. Also, BIG bonus, you won't wake up in the middle of the night and step on soggy rawhide or pig-ear vomit. Gotta love that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and looks durable, but my dog lose interest pretty quickly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy! Looks like it would last a while. My dog likes it the first couple of days then lose interest. I was hoping it would keep her occupied for a while...
customer_reviews.author: Wakart

customer_reviews.title: Good but my silly dogs prefer sticks
customer_reviews.text: I don't like giving my dogs bones because of breaking teeth, or raw hide because of the dodgy glue that's used. I thought this was the perfect solution for my big dogs, unfortunately they just didn't take to it. My male Great Dane cross does like to carry it around for fun, but he prefers to chew sticks instead. I do think it's a much better alternative to other chew products and it's worth giving it a go!
customer_reviews.author: CMM1984

customer_reviews.title: So strong!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! So much stronger than Kong and regular Nylabone! Reminds me of material Tupperware used for their oven line back in the early 90s. My granddogger tears dog toys up but not this one. Plus, she loves it! Now we have a reliable brand to buy for her.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Husky Approved!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Siberian Husky. She loves Nylabones but the smaller ones don't last her long enough. Shes had this for a little over a month now and she hasn't even made it past the ends. Its perfect for her, it occupys her for hours at a time. The only thing I wish it had was a glow in the dark option. I cant tell you how many times I have stepped on this thing and almost broke my ankle. I highly recommend this to anyone who had a dog that enjoys chew bones but they don't last them more than a day.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: My dog absolutely loves this thing. The only reason ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this thing. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that after a few days of him chewing it, there are sharp edges all over it which have made his gums bleed. I used a heavy duty nail file to file down the sharp parts, but I have to keep checking to make sure there aren't more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 🙄
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my pup would not engage with this at all. Took two days and i finally slabbed some peanut butter on the long part of the bone and since then he’s obsessed. Holds up to his super chewy mode. Update 8/7: he has DESTROYED this toy. We were watching tv and heard him cough and looked over to see the end of the toy in his mouth look like the pictures. Threw away immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Leah B

customer_reviews.title: high quality bone that lasts
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are able to chew through just about everything. This is the one bone that they can't destroy and they love this bone. It is thick and has nubs on it to help clean their teeth. If you have a dog that destroys all toys buy this bone. They will not be able to destroy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: One month and still in good shape
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for new chew toys for my 100 pound Pitt Bull, and this seemed like it was worth a try. My guy chews through virtually any toy I give him quickly, and his love for chewing is limited to toys, so I'm happy to keep him supplied. This particular toy has been in his possession for over a month and is still not falling to pieces, and it is still one of his favorites. For me, that's the highest kudos I can give. I do recommend it for those hardy chewers who make mincemeat of most of the other "durable" toys out there... I will be buying more of these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Priest

customer_reviews.title: A bone to keep my dog busy
customer_reviews.text: I have a corgi who loves to chew and gets through bones marketed towards larger dogs with ease. This one, however, is very sturdy. He’s had it for about a week now and hasn’t made much of a dent in it so far - which is saying something for him, since he tends to go through bones quickly. Definitely worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: ZJ

customer_reviews.title: For dogs over 15 lbs. In my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 smallish dogs and neither wanted to play with it. So I sent it to my daughter for her boxer mix. Not sure how much he likes it but I think the size was better suited for his size. He has loved the other Nylabone toys I've gotten him.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaskia

customer_reviews.title: long lasting safe fun for dogs of all sizes
customer_reviews.text: One of only 2 bones I buy my 3 dogs. Purchased this in July and the are still chewing it in December! My older dog is an aggressive chewer and rubber balls and bones last about 15 minutes! She demolishes rubber toys and ropes, swallowing small pieces that pose a risk for choking and bowel obstruction. Nylabone is a great product, loved by all 3 dogs and long lasting. They do not break apart into small pieces and even come in "flavors."
customer_reviews.author: Diane McNealy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material but it cut our dog's gums
customer_reviews.text: Our dog really liked this toy... which became an issue when she kept chewing on it even after it started slicing open her gums. She's an enthusiastic chewer, but she's had plenty of other chew bones/toys that have not cut her mouth. Might be the material itself, or could have been caused by the little sharp bumps that are part of the design, I'm not sure. After a few tries, we eventually had to take it away from her and throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: merituni

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a cudgel!
customer_reviews.text: My dog, American Bulldog, hates this toy. She has carried it around maybe twice since I purchased it. It is entirely too hard and she shows no interest whatsoever in chewing on it. However, if anyone tries to break into my home, I can use it to knock them out.
customer_reviews.author: Xerran

customer_reviews.title: One of the better Nylabones
customer_reviews.text: I always buy the strongest Nylabones for my dog because he destroys them so quickly. This one seems to be thicker/wider than most of the Nylabones I’ve gotten him so I have hope that it may last a little longer than usual
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine & Jordan

product_meta.title: Nylabone Barbell Power Chew Durable Dog Toy
product_meta.description: Size:Medium/Wolf| Color:-Powerful dogs wish for tough chew toys! Made with tough, durable nylon, our Power Chew Peanut Butter Dog Chew Toy is the long lasting chew toy you need for your aggressive chewer. This power chew keeps dogs busy, satisfies their natural urge to chew, and encourages positive chewing habits. Plus, the bristles raised during chewing promote clean teeth and help control plaque and tartar buildup. Go ahead and throw your dog a Nylabone!
feature_bullets: Long lasting chew toy challenges even the most aggressive chewers
Nylon bone satisfies the natural urge to chew
Bristles raised during chewing help clean teeth and control plaque and tartar
Medium dog toy intended for canines up to 35 pounds
Flavored dog chew contains delicious allergen free peanut butter flavor dogs love

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
